title.narrative: HIV PREVENTION, TREATMENT AND CARE

description.narrative: By 2016, effective health policies and programmes reduce MTCT and youth HIV infection and increase testing and treatment., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, government capacity to deliver equitable quality child survival and development services reduces child mortality and morbidity.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN Place(Annex) Matsitama Road P O Box 20678 Gaborone

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, effective health policies and programmes reduce MTCT and youth HIV infection and increase testing and treatment.

description.narrative: In 2016, a National Programming Framework on HIV for Adolescents and Young Adults in Botswana 2016-2020 was completed, in-depth analysis conducted in four districts on bottleneck for adolescent treatment, care and prevention of HIV and development of a strategy for Voluntary Medical Male Circumcision initiated. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2017

title.narrative: Mother to Child Transmission of HIV rate
Proportion of males and females aged 8-24 (with sub-analysis for 8-14, 15-19) with comprehensive correct knowledge of HIV/AIDS.

actual.value: 2016:48% of 15-24 year old men and women have comprehensive knowledge on HIV/AIDS (BAIS 2013). Another BAIS survey due in 2017

title.narrative: Proportion of infants born to HIV infected women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Proportion of HIV positive pregnant women on ARVs for PMTCT or their own health
Percentage of HIV exposed new-borns receiving effective ARVs for PMTCT
National HIV/AIDS strategies that include proven high-impact evidence-based interventions to address HIV among adolescents available
Availability of updated PMTCT guidelines in line with international standards

actual.value: 2016:Option B+ guidelines being implemented and integrated as part of test and treat.
